    SD2Vita

    If you like the guide, please consider donating via PayPal.

    If you have any issues or problems, read the FAQ or ask on our Discord Server.

    SD2Vita is a microSD to gamecard adapter for the PS Vita. This means that you can use a microSD card as storage for your Vita instead of Sony’s expensive proprietary memory cards.

    Make sure your Vita and computer are connected to the same internet

    The first part of this guide requires you to have Windows

    You must have the latest version of VitaShell installed

    Downloads

    • An FTP Client
      • For Windows, I’d recommend FileZilla or WinSCP
    • The latest release of gamecard-microsd
    • The latest release of Win32 Disk Imager
    • zzBlank.img

    Formatting your microSD Card

    1. Insert your microSD card into your computer
    2. Open Win32 Disk Imager
    3. Select zzBlank.img from your computer
    4. Select your microSD card
    5. Press “Write”
    6. Take out your microSD card and put it back in
    7. Format your microSD card from Windows
    8. Select the following options
      • File System: exFAT
      • Allocation Unit Size: Default Allocation Size
      • Don’t put in a volume label

    Installing SD2Vita

    Make sure your Vita and computer are connected to the same internet

    1. Open VitaShell on your Vita
    2. Press Select
    3. Open your FTP client on your computer
    4. Type in the IP Address and Port shown on your Vita
    5. Insert your MicroSD Card into your computer
    6. Format your microSD card
    7. Copy the contents of ux0 to your microSD card
    8. Eject your MicroSD Card and put it into your SD2Vita card
    9. Navigate to ux0:data on the FTP Client
    10. Transfer the gamesd.skprx file
    11. Press O to close the FTP server
    12. Navigate to ux0:data on your Vita
    13. Go to the gamesd.skprx file and press Triangle
    14. Select “Copy”
    15. Navigate to ur0:tai on your Vita
    16. Press Triangle and select “Paste”
    17. Open config.txt
    18. Go to *KERNEL and press Triangle
    19. Select “Insert Empty Line”
    20. Type into the new line ur0:tai/gamesd.skprx
    21. Exit and save changes
    22. Insert your SD2Vita card into the Vita with the MicroSD card inserted
    23. Reboot your Vita
